text_entry: The best and soundest of his time hath been but

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: rash; then must we look to receive from his age,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: not alone the imperfections of long-engraffed

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: condition, but therewithal the unruly waywardness

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: that infirm and choleric years bring with them.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Such unconstant starts are we like to have from

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: him as this of Kent's banishment.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: There is further compliment of leavetaking

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: between France and him. Pray you, let's hit

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: together: if our father carry authority with

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: such dispositions as he bears, this last

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: surrender of his will but offend us.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: We shall further think on't.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: We must do something, and i' the heat.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: SCENE II. The Earl of Gloucester's castle.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Enter EDMUND, with a letter

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Thou, nature, art my goddess; to thy law

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: My services are bound. Wherefore should I

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Stand in the plague of custom, and permit

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: The curiosity of nations to deprive me,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: For that I am some twelve or fourteen moon-shines

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Lag of a brother? Why bastard? wherefore base?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: When my dimensions are as well compact,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: My mind as generous, and my shape as true,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: As honest madam's issue? Why brand they us

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: With base? with baseness? bastardy? base, base?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Who, in the lusty stealth of nature, take

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: More composition and fierce quality

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Than doth, within a dull, stale, tired bed,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Go to the creating a whole tribe of fops,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Got 'tween asleep and wake? Well, then,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Legitimate Edgar, I must have your land:

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Our father's love is to the bastard Edmund

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: As to the legitimate: fine word,--legitimate!

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Well, my legitimate, if this letter speed,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: And my invention thrive, Edmund the base

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Shall top the legitimate. I grow; I prosper:

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Now, gods, stand up for bastards!

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Enter GLOUCESTER

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Kent banish'd thus! and France in choler parted!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And the king gone to-night! subscribed his power!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Confined to exhibition! All this done

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Upon the gad! Edmund, how now! what news?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: So please your lordship, none.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Putting up the letter

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Why so earnestly seek you to put up that letter?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: I know no news, my lord.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: What paper were you reading?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Nothing, my lord.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: No? What needed, then, that terrible dispatch of

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: it into your pocket? the quality of nothing hath

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: not such need to hide itself. Let's see: come,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: if it be nothing, I shall not need spectacles.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: I beseech you, sir, pardon me: it is a letter

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: from my brother, that I have not all o'er-read;

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: and for so much as I have perused, I find it not

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: fit for your o'er-looking.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Give me the letter, sir.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: I shall offend, either to detain or give it. The

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: contents, as in part I understand them, are to blame.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Let's see, let's see.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: I hope, for my brother's justification, he wrote

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: this but as an essay or taste of my virtue.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: [Reads]  'This policy and reverence of age makes

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: the world bitter to the best of our times; keeps

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: our fortunes from us till our oldness cannot relish

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: them. I begin to find an idle and fond bondage

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: in the oppression of aged tyranny; who sways, not

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: as it hath power, but as it is suffered. Come to

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: me, that of this I may speak more. If our father

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: would sleep till I waked him, you should half his

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: revenue for ever, and live the beloved of your

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: brother, EDGAR.'

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Hum--conspiracy!--'Sleep till I waked him,--you

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: should enjoy half his revenue,'--My son Edgar!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Had he a hand to write this? a heart and brain

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: to breed it in?--When came this to you? who

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: brought it?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: It was not brought me, my lord; there's the

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: cunning of it; I found it thrown in at the

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: casement of my closet.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: You know the character to be your brother's?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: If the matter were good, my lord, I durst swear

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: it were his; but, in respect of that, I would

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: fain think it were not.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: It is his.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: It is his hand, my lord; but I hope his heart is

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: not in the contents.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Hath he never heretofore sounded you in this business?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Never, my lord: but I have heard him oft

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: maintain it to be fit, that, sons at perfect age,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: and fathers declining, the father should be as

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: ward to the son, and the son manage his revenue.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: O villain, villain! His very opinion in the

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: letter! Abhorred villain! Unnatural, detested,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: brutish villain! worse than brutish! Go, sirrah,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: seek him; I'll apprehend him: abominable villain!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Where is he?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: I do not well know, my lord. If it shall please

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: you to suspend your indignation against my

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: brother till you can derive from him better

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: testimony of his intent, you shall run a certain

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: course; where, if you violently proceed against

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: him, mistaking his purpose, it would make a great

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: gap in your own honour, and shake in pieces the

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: heart of his obedience. I dare pawn down my life

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: for him, that he hath wrote this to feel my

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: affection to your honour, and to no further

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: pretence of danger.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Think you so?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: If your honour judge it meet, I will place you

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: where you shall hear us confer of this, and by an

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: auricular assurance have your satisfaction; and

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: that without any further delay than this very evening.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: He cannot be such a monster--

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Nor is not, sure.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To his father, that so tenderly and entirely

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: loves him. Heaven and earth! Edmund, seek him

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: out: wind me into him, I pray you: frame the

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: business after your own wisdom. I would unstate

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: myself, to be in a due resolution.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: I will seek him, sir, presently: convey the

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: business as I shall find means and acquaint you withal.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: These late eclipses in the sun and moon portend

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: no good to us: though the wisdom of nature can

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: reason it thus and thus, yet nature finds itself

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: scourged by the sequent effects: love cools,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: friendship falls off, brothers divide: in

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: cities, mutinies; in countries, discord; in

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: palaces, treason; and the bond cracked 'twixt son

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: and father. This villain of mine comes under the

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: prediction; there's son against father: the king

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: falls from bias of nature; there's father against

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: child. We have seen the best of our time:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: machinations, hollowness, treachery, and all

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: ruinous disorders, follow us disquietly to our

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: graves. Find out this villain, Edmund; it shall

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: lose thee nothing; do it carefully. And the

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: noble and true-hearted Kent banished! his

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: offence, honesty! 'Tis strange.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Exit

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: This is the excellent foppery of the world, that,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: when we are sick in fortune,--often the surfeit

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: of our own behavior,--we make guilty of our

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: disasters the sun, the moon, and the stars: as

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: if we were villains by necessity; fools by

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: heavenly compulsion; knaves, thieves, and

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: treachers, by spherical predominance; drunkards,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: liars, and adulterers, by an enforced obedience of

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: planetary influence; and all that we are evil in,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: by a divine thrusting on: an admirable evasion

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: of whoremaster man, to lay his goatish

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: disposition to the charge of a star! My

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: father compounded with my mother under the

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: dragon's tail; and my nativity was under Ursa

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: major; so that it follows, I am rough and

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: lecherous. Tut, I should have been that I am,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: had the maidenliest star in the firmament

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: twinkled on my bastardizing. Edgar--

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Enter EDGAR

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: And pat he comes like the catastrophe of the old

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: comedy: my cue is villanous melancholy, with a

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: sigh like Tom o' Bedlam. O, these eclipses do

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: portend these divisions! fa, sol, la, mi.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: How now, brother Edmund! what serious

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: contemplation are you in?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: I am thinking, brother, of a prediction I read

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: this other day, what should follow these eclipses.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Do you busy yourself about that?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: I promise you, the effects he writes of succeed

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: unhappily; as of unnaturalness between the child

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: and the parent; death, dearth, dissolutions of

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: ancient amities; divisions in state, menaces and

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: maledictions against king and nobles; needless

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: diffidences, banishment of friends, dissipation

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: of cohorts, nuptial breaches, and I know not what.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: How long have you been a sectary astronomical?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Come, come; when saw you my father last?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Why, the night gone by.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Spake you with him?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Ay, two hours together.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Parted you in good terms? Found you no

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: displeasure in him by word or countenance?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: None at all.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Bethink yourself wherein you may have offended

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: him: and at my entreaty forbear his presence

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: till some little time hath qualified the heat of

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: his displeasure; which at this instant so rageth

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: in him, that with the mischief of your person it

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: would scarcely allay.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Some villain hath done me wrong.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: That's my fear. I pray you, have a continent

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: forbearance till the spied of his rage goes

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: slower; and, as I say, retire with me to my

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: lodging, from whence I will fitly bring you to

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: hear my lord speak: pray ye, go; there's my key:

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: if you do stir abroad, go armed.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Armed, brother!

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Brother, I advise you to the best; go armed: I

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: am no honest man if there be any good meaning

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: towards you: I have told you what I have seen

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: and heard; but faintly, nothing like the image

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: and horror of it: pray you, away.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Shall I hear from you anon?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: I do serve you in this business.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Exit EDGAR

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: A credulous father! and a brother noble,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Whose nature is so far from doing harms,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: That he suspects none: on whose foolish honesty

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: My practises ride easy! I see the business.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Let me, if not by birth, have lands by wit:

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: All with me's meet that I can fashion fit.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Exit

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: SCENE III. The Duke of Albany's palace.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Enter GONERIL, and OSWALD, her steward

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Did my father strike my gentleman for chiding of his fool?

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Yes, madam.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: By day and night he wrongs me; every hour

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: He flashes into one gross crime or other,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: That sets us all at odds: I'll not endure it:

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: His knights grow riotous, and himself upbraids us

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: On every trifle. When he returns from hunting,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: I will not speak with him; say I am sick:

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: If you come slack of former services,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: You shall do well; the fault of it I'll answer.

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: He's coming, madam; I hear him.

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Horns within

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Put on what weary negligence you please,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: You and your fellows; I'll have it come to question:

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: If he dislike it, let him to our sister,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Whose mind and mine, I know, in that are one,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Not to be over-ruled. Idle old man,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: That still would manage those authorities

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: That he hath given away! Now, by my life,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Old fools are babes again; and must be used

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: With cheques as flatteries,--when they are seen abused.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Remember what I tell you.

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Well, madam.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: And let his knights have colder looks among you;

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: What grows of it, no matter; advise your fellows so:

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: I would breed from hence occasions, and I shall,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: That I may speak: I'll write straight to my sister,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: To hold my very course. Prepare for dinner.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: SCENE IV. A hall in the same.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Enter KENT, disguised

speaker: KENT
text_entry: If but as well I other accents borrow,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: That can my speech defuse, my good intent

speaker: KENT
text_entry: May carry through itself to that full issue

speaker: KENT
text_entry: For which I razed my likeness. Now, banish'd Kent,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: If thou canst serve where thou dost stand condemn'd,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: So may it come, thy master, whom thou lovest,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Shall find thee full of labours.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Horns within. Enter KING LEAR, Knights, and Attendants

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Let me not stay a jot for dinner; go get it ready.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Exit an Attendant

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: How now! what art thou?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: A man, sir.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What dost thou profess? what wouldst thou with us?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: I do profess to be no less than I seem; to serve

speaker: KENT
text_entry: him truly that will put me in trust: to love him

speaker: KENT
text_entry: that is honest; to converse with him that is wise,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: and says little; to fear judgment; to fight when I

speaker: KENT
text_entry: cannot choose; and to eat no fish.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What art thou?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: A very honest-hearted fellow, and as poor as the king.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: If thou be as poor for a subject as he is for a

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: king, thou art poor enough. What wouldst thou?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Service.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Who wouldst thou serve?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: You.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Dost thou know me, fellow?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: No, sir; but you have that in your countenance

speaker: KENT
text_entry: which I would fain call master.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What's that?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Authority.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What services canst thou do?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: I can keep honest counsel, ride, run, mar a curious

speaker: KENT
text_entry: tale in telling it, and deliver a plain message

speaker: KENT
text_entry: bluntly: that which ordinary men are fit for, I am

speaker: KENT
text_entry: qualified in; and the best of me is diligence.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: How old art thou?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Not so young, sir, to love a woman for singing, nor

speaker: KENT
text_entry: so old to dote on her for any thing: I have years

speaker: KENT
text_entry: on my back forty eight.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Follow me; thou shalt serve me: if I like thee no

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: worse after dinner, I will not part from thee yet.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Dinner, ho, dinner! Where's my knave? my fool?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Go you, and call my fool hither.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Exit an Attendant

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Enter OSWALD

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: You, you, sirrah, where's my daughter?

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: So please you,--

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Exit

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What says the fellow there? Call the clotpoll back.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Exit a Knight

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Where's my fool, ho? I think the world's asleep.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Re-enter Knight

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: How now! where's that mongrel?

speaker: Knight
text_entry: He says, my lord, your daughter is not well.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Why came not the slave back to me when I called him.

speaker: Knight
text_entry: Sir, he answered me in the roundest manner, he would

speaker: Knight
text_entry: not.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: He would not!

speaker: Knight
text_entry: My lord, I know not what the matter is; but, to my

speaker: Knight
text_entry: judgment, your highness is not entertained with that

speaker: Knight
text_entry: ceremonious affection as you were wont; there's a

speaker: Knight
text_entry: great abatement of kindness appears as well in the

speaker: Knight
text_entry: general dependants as in the duke himself also and

speaker: Knight
text_entry: your daughter.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Ha! sayest thou so?

speaker: Knight
text_entry: I beseech you, pardon me, my lord, if I be mistaken;

speaker: Knight
text_entry: for my duty cannot be silent when I think your

speaker: Knight
text_entry: highness wronged.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thou but rememberest me of mine own conception: I

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: have perceived a most faint neglect of late; which I

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: have rather blamed as mine own jealous curiosity

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: than as a very pretence and purpose of unkindness:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I will look further into't. But where's my fool? I

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: have not seen him this two days.

speaker: Knight
text_entry: Since my young lady's going into France, sir, the

speaker: Knight
text_entry: fool hath much pined away.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No more of that; I have noted it well. Go you, and

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: tell my daughter I would speak with her.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Exit an Attendant

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Go you, call hither my fool.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Exit an Attendant

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Re-enter OSWALD

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: O, you sir, you, come you hither, sir: who am I,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: sir?

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: My lady's father.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: 'My lady's father'! my lord's knave: your

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: whoreson dog! you slave! you cur!

text_entry: I am none of these, my lord; I beseech your pardon.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Striking him

text_entry: Nor tripped neither, you base football player.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: away, away! if you will measure your lubber's

text_entry: length again, tarry: but away! go to; have you

text_entry: wisdom? so.

text_entry: How now, my pretty knave! how dost thou?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Sirrah, you were best take my coxcomb.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Why, fool?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Why, for taking one's part that's out of favour:

speaker: Fool
text_entry: nay, an thou canst not smile as the wind sits,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: thou'lt catch cold shortly: there, take my coxcomb:

speaker: Fool
text_entry: why, this fellow has banished two on's daughters,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: and did the third a blessing against his will; if

speaker: Fool
text_entry: thou follow him, thou must needs wear my coxcomb.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: How now, nuncle! Would I had two coxcombs and two daughters!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Why, my boy?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: If I gave them all my living, I'ld keep my coxcombs

speaker: Fool
text_entry: myself. There's mine; beg another of thy daughters.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Take heed, sirrah; the whip.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Truth's a dog must to kennel; he must be whipped

speaker: Fool
text_entry: out, when Lady the brach may stand by the fire and stink.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: A pestilent gall to me!

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Sirrah, I'll teach thee a speech.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Do.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Mark it, nuncle:

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Have more than thou showest,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Speak less than thou knowest,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Lend less than thou owest,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Ride more than thou goest,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Learn more than thou trowest,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Set less than thou throwest;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Leave thy drink and thy whore,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: And keep in-a-door,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: And thou shalt have more

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Than two tens to a score.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: This is nothing, fool.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Then 'tis like the breath of an unfee'd lawyer; you

speaker: Fool
text_entry: gave me nothing for't. Can you make no use of

speaker: Fool
text_entry: nothing, nuncle?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Why, no, boy; nothing can be made out of nothing.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: [To KENT]  Prithee, tell him, so much the rent of

speaker: Fool
text_entry: his land comes to: he will not believe a fool.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: A bitter fool!

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Dost thou know the difference, my boy, between a

speaker: Fool
text_entry: bitter fool and a sweet fool?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No, lad; teach me.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: That lord that counsell'd thee

speaker: Fool
text_entry: To give away thy land,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Come place him here by me,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Do thou for him stand:

speaker: Fool
text_entry: The sweet and bitter fool

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Will presently appear;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: The one in motley here,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: The other found out there.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Dost thou call me fool, boy?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: All thy other titles thou hast given away; that

speaker: Fool
text_entry: thou wast born with.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: This is not altogether fool, my lord.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: No, faith, lords and great men will not let me; if

speaker: Fool
text_entry: I had a monopoly out, they would have part on't:

speaker: Fool
text_entry: and ladies too, they will not let me have all fool

speaker: Fool
text_entry: to myself; they'll be snatching. Give me an egg,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: nuncle, and I'll give thee two crowns.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What two crowns shall they be?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Why, after I have cut the egg i' the middle, and eat

speaker: Fool
text_entry: up the meat, the two crowns of the egg. When thou

speaker: Fool
text_entry: clovest thy crown i' the middle, and gavest away

speaker: Fool
text_entry: both parts, thou borest thy ass on thy back o'er

speaker: Fool
text_entry: the dirt: thou hadst little wit in thy bald crown,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: when thou gavest thy golden one away. If I speak

speaker: Fool
text_entry: like myself in this, let him be whipped that first

speaker: Fool
text_entry: finds it so.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Singing

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Fools had ne'er less wit in a year;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: For wise men are grown foppish,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: They know not how their wits to wear,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Their manners are so apish.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: When were you wont to be so full of songs, sirrah?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: I have used it, nuncle, ever since thou madest thy

speaker: Fool
text_entry: daughters thy mothers: for when thou gavest them

speaker: Fool
text_entry: the rod, and put'st down thine own breeches,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Singing

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Then they for sudden joy did weep,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: And I for sorrow sung,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: That such a king should play bo-peep,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: And go the fools among.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Prithee, nuncle, keep a schoolmaster that can teach

speaker: Fool
text_entry: thy fool to lie: I would fain learn to lie.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: An you lie, sirrah, we'll have you whipped.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: I marvel what kin thou and thy daughters are:

speaker: Fool
text_entry: they'll have me whipped for speaking true, thou'lt

speaker: Fool
text_entry: have me whipped for lying; and sometimes I am

speaker: Fool
text_entry: whipped for holding my peace. I had rather be any

speaker: Fool
text_entry: kind o' thing than a fool: and yet I would not be

speaker: Fool
text_entry: thee, nuncle; thou hast pared thy wit o' both sides,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: and left nothing i' the middle: here comes one o'

speaker: Fool
text_entry: the parings.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Enter GONERIL

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: How now, daughter! what makes that frontlet on?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Methinks you are too much of late i' the frown.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Thou wast a pretty fellow when thou hadst no need to

speaker: Fool
text_entry: care for her frowning; now thou art an O without a

speaker: Fool
text_entry: figure: I am better than thou art now; I am a fool,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: thou art nothing.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: To GONERIL

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Yes, forsooth, I will hold my tongue; so your face

speaker: Fool
text_entry: bids me, though you say nothing. Mum, mum,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: He that keeps nor crust nor crum,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Weary of all, shall want some.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Pointing to KING LEAR

speaker: Fool
text_entry: That's a shealed peascod.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Not only, sir, this your all-licensed fool,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: But other of your insolent retinue

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Do hourly carp and quarrel; breaking forth

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: In rank and not-to-be endured riots. Sir,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: I had thought, by making this well known unto you,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: To have found a safe redress; but now grow fearful,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: By what yourself too late have spoke and done.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: That you protect this course, and put it on

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: By your allowance; which if you should, the fault

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Would not 'scape censure, nor the redresses sleep,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Which, in the tender of a wholesome weal,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Might in their working do you that offence,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Which else were shame, that then necessity

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Will call discreet proceeding.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: For, you trow, nuncle,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: The hedge-sparrow fed the cuckoo so long,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: That it's had it head bit off by it young.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: So, out went the candle, and we were left darkling.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Are you our daughter?

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Come, sir,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: I would you would make use of that good wisdom,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Whereof I know you are fraught; and put away

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: These dispositions, that of late transform you

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: From what you rightly are.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: May not an ass know when the cart

speaker: Fool
text_entry: draws the horse? Whoop, Jug! I love thee.

text_entry: Doth any here know me? This is not Lear:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Doth Lear walk thus? speak thus? Where are his eyes?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Either his notion weakens, his discernings

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Are lethargied--Ha! waking? 'tis not so.

text_entry: Who is it that can tell me who I am?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Lear's shadow.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I would learn that; for, by the

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: marks of sovereignty, knowledge, and reason,

text_entry: I should be false persuaded I had daughters.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Which they will make an obedient father.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Your name, fair gentlewoman?

text_entry: This admiration, sir, is much o' the savour

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Of other your new pranks. I do beseech you

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: To understand my purposes aright:

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: As you are old and reverend, you should be wise.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Here do you keep a hundred knights and squires;

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Men so disorder'd, so debosh'd and bold,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: That this our court, infected with their manners,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Shows like a riotous inn: epicurism and lust

text_entry: Make it more like a tavern or a brothel

text_entry: Than a graced palace. The shame itself doth speak

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: For instant remedy: be then desired

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: By her, that else will take the thing she begs,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: A little to disquantity your train;

speaker: GONERIL

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: To be such men as may besort your age,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: And know themselves and you.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Darkness and devils!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Saddle my horses; call my train together:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Degenerate bastard! I'll not trouble thee.

text_entry: Yet have I left a daughter.

text_entry: You strike my people; and your disorder'd rabble

text_entry: O, sir, are you come?

text_entry: Is it your will? Speak, sir. Prepare my horses.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Ingratitude, thou marble-hearted fiend,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That all particulars of duty know,

text_entry: And in the most exact regard support

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The worships of their name. O most small fault,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: How ugly didst thou in Cordelia show!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That, like an engine, wrench'd my frame of nature

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: From the fix'd place; drew from heart all love,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And added to the gall. O Lear, Lear, Lear!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Beat at this gate, that let thy folly in,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Striking his head

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And thy dear judgment out! Go, go, my people.

text_entry: My lord, I am guiltless, as I am ignorant

text_entry: It may be so, my lord.

text_entry: Hear, nature, hear; dear goddess, hear!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Suspend thy purpose, if thou didst intend

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To make this creature fruitful!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Into her womb convey sterility!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Dry up in her the organs of increase;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And from her derogate body never spring

text_entry: A babe to honour her! If she must teem,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Create her child of spleen; that it may live,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And be a thwart disnatured torment to her!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Let it stamp wrinkles in her brow of youth;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: With cadent tears fret channels in her cheeks;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Turn all her mother's pains and benefits

text_entry: To laughter and contempt; that she may feel

text_entry: How sharper than a serpent's tooth it is

speaker: KING LEAR

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Now, gods that we adore, whereof comes this?

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Never afflict yourself to know the cause;

speaker: GONERIL

text_entry: What, fifty of my followers at a clap!

text_entry: What's the matter, sir?

speaker: KING LEAR

text_entry: Life and death! I am ashamed

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That thou hast power to shake my manhood thus;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That these hot tears, which break from me perforce,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Should make thee worth them. Blasts and fogs upon thee!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The untented woundings of a father's curse

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Pierce every sense about thee! Old fond eyes,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Beweep this cause again, I'll pluck ye out,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And cast you, with the waters that you lose,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To temper clay. Yea, it is come to this?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Let is be so: yet have I left a daughter,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Who, I am sure, is kind and comfortable:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: When she shall hear this of thee, with her nails

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: She'll flay thy wolvish visage. Thou shalt find

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That I'll resume the shape which thou dost think

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I have cast off for ever: thou shalt,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I warrant thee.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Do you mark that, my lord?

text_entry: I cannot be so partial, Goneril,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: To the great love I bear you,--

speaker: Fool
text_entry: And such a daughter,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: If my cap would buy a halter:

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: This man hath had good counsel:--a hundred knights!

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: 'Tis politic and safe to let him keep

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: At point a hundred knights: yes, that, on every dream,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Each buzz, each fancy, each complaint, dislike,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: He may enguard his dotage with their powers,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: And hold our lives in mercy. Oswald, I say!

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Well, you may fear too far.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Safer than trust too far:

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Let me still take away the harms I fear,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Not fear still to be taken: I know his heart.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: What he hath utter'd I have writ my sister

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: If she sustain him and his hundred knights

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: When I have show'd the unfitness,--

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: How now, Oswald!

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: What, have you writ that letter to my sister?

text_entry: Yes, madam.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Take you some company, and away to horse:

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Inform her full of my particular fear;

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: And thereto add such reasons of your own

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: As may compact it more. Get you gone;

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: And hasten your return.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: No, no, my lord,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: This milky gentleness and course of yours

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Though I condemn not, yet, under pardon,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: You are much more attask'd for want of wisdom

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Than praised for harmful mildness.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: How far your eyes may pierce I can not tell:

speaker: ALBANY

text_entry: Nay, then--

speaker: ALBANY

text_entry: Ay, boy.

text_entry: Then, I prithee, be merry; thy wit shall ne'er go

text_entry: slip-shod.

text_entry: Ha, ha, ha!

speaker: Fool

text_entry: Why, what canst thou tell, my boy?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: She will taste as like this as a crab does to a

speaker: Fool
text_entry: crab. Thou canst tell why one's nose stands i'

speaker: Fool
text_entry: the middle on's face?

text_entry: No.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Why, to keep one's eyes of either side's nose; that

speaker: Fool
text_entry: what a man cannot smell out, he may spy into.

text_entry: I did her wrong--

text_entry: No.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Nor I neither; but I can tell why a snail has a house.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Why?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Why, to put his head in; not to give it away to his

speaker: Fool
text_entry: daughters, and leave his horns without a case.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I will forget my nature. So kind a father! Be my

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: horses ready?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Thy asses are gone about 'em. The reason why the

speaker: Fool
text_entry: seven stars are no more than seven is a pretty reason.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Because they are not eight?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Yes, indeed: thou wouldst make a good fool.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To take 't again perforce! Monster ingratitude!

speaker: Fool
text_entry: If thou wert my fool, nuncle, I'ld have thee beaten

speaker: Fool
text_entry: for being old before thy time.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: How's that?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Thou shouldst not have been old till thou hadst

speaker: Fool

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Are in the poorest thing superfluous:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Allow not nature more than nature needs,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Man's life's as cheap as beast's: thou art a lady;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: If only to go warm were gorgeous,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Why, nature needs not what thou gorgeous wear'st,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Which scarcely keeps thee warm. But, for true need,--

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: You heavens, give me that patience, patience I need!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: You see me here, you gods, a poor old man,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: As full of grief as age; wretched in both!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: If it be you that stir these daughters' hearts

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Against their father, fool me not so much

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To bear it tamely; touch me with noble anger,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And let not women's weapons, water-drops,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Stain my man's cheeks! No, you unnatural hags,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I will have such revenges on you both,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That all the world shall--I will do such things,--

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What they are, yet I know not: but they shall be

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The terrors of the earth. You think I'll weep

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No, I'll not weep:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I have full cause of weeping; but this heart

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Shall break into a hundred thousand flaws,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Or ere I'll weep. O fool, I shall go mad!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Exeunt KING LEAR, GLOUCESTER, KENT, and Fool

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Storm and tempest

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Let us withdraw; 'twill be a storm.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: This house is little: the old man and his people

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Cannot be well bestow'd.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: 'Tis his own blame; hath put himself from rest,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: And must needs taste his folly.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: For his particular, I'll receive him gladly,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: But not one follower.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: So am I purposed.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Where is my lord of Gloucester?

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Follow'd the old man forth: he is return'd.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Re-enter GLOUCESTER

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: The king is in high rage.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Whither is he going?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: He calls to horse; but will I know not whither.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: 'Tis best to give him way; he leads himself.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: My lord, entreat him by no means to stay.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Alack, the night comes on, and the bleak winds

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Do sorely ruffle; for many miles a bout

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: There's scarce a bush.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: O, sir, to wilful men,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: The injuries that they themselves procure

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Must be their schoolmasters. Shut up your doors:

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: He is attended with a desperate train;

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: And what they may incense him to, being apt

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: To have his ear abused, wisdom bids fear.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Shut up your doors, my lord; 'tis a wild night:

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: My Regan counsels well; come out o' the storm.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: ACT III

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: SCENE I. A heath.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Storm still. Enter KENT and a Gentleman, meeting

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Who's there, besides foul weather?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: One minded like the weather, most unquietly.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: I know you. Where's the king?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Contending with the fretful element:

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Bids the winds blow the earth into the sea,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Or swell the curled water 'bove the main,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: That things might change or cease; tears his white hair,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Which the impetuous blasts, with eyeless rage,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Catch in their fury, and make nothing of;

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Strives in his little world of man to out-scorn

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: The to-and-fro-conflicting wind and rain.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: This night, wherein the cub-drawn bear would couch,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: The lion and the belly-pinched wolf

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Keep their fur dry, unbonneted he runs,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: And bids what will take all.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: But who is with him?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: None but the fool; who labours to out-jest

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: His heart-struck injuries.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Sir, I do know you;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: And dare, upon the warrant of my note,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Commend a dear thing to you. There is division,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Although as yet the face of it be cover'd

speaker: KENT
text_entry: With mutual cunning, 'twixt Albany and Cornwall;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Who have--as who have not, that their great stars

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Throned and set high?--servants, who seem no less,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Which are to France the spies and speculations

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Intelligent of our state; what hath been seen,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Either in snuffs and packings of the dukes,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Or the hard rein which both of them have borne

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Against the old kind king; or something deeper,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Whereof perchance these are but furnishings;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: But, true it is, from France there comes a power

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Into this scatter'd kingdom; who already,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Wise in our negligence, have secret feet

speaker: KENT
text_entry: In some of our best ports, and are at point

speaker: KENT
text_entry: To show their open banner. Now to you:

speaker: KENT
text_entry: If on my credit you dare build so far

speaker: KENT
text_entry: To make your speed to Dover, you shall find

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Some that will thank you, making just report

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Of how unnatural and bemadding sorrow

speaker: KENT
text_entry: The king hath cause to plain.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: I am a gentleman of blood and breeding;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: And, from some knowledge and assurance, offer

speaker: KENT
text_entry: This office to you.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: I will talk further with you.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: No, do not.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: For confirmation that I am much more

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Than my out-wall, open this purse, and take

speaker: KENT
text_entry: What it contains. If you shall see Cordelia,--

speaker: KENT
text_entry: As fear not but you shall,--show her this ring;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: And she will tell you who your fellow is

speaker: KENT
text_entry: That yet you do not know. Fie on this storm!

speaker: KENT
text_entry: I will go seek the king.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Give me your hand: have you no more to say?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Few words, but, to effect, more than all yet;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: That, when we have found the king,--in which your pain

speaker: KENT
text_entry: That way, I'll this,--he that first lights on him

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Holla the other.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Exeunt severally

speaker: KENT
text_entry: SCENE II. Another part of the heath. Storm still.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Enter KING LEAR and Fool

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Blow, winds, and crack your cheeks! rage! blow!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: You cataracts and hurricanoes, spout

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Till you have drench'd our steeples, drown'd the cocks!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: You sulphurous and thought-executing fires,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Vaunt-couriers to oak-cleaving thunderbolts,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Singe my white head! And thou, all-shaking thunder,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Smite flat the thick rotundity o' the world!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Crack nature's moulds, an germens spill at once,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That make ingrateful man!

speaker: Fool
text_entry: O nuncle, court holy-water in a dry

speaker: Fool
text_entry: house is better than this rain-water out o' door.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Good nuncle, in, and ask thy daughters' blessing:

speaker: Fool
text_entry: here's a night pities neither wise man nor fool.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Rumble thy bellyful! Spit, fire! spout, rain!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Nor rain, wind, thunder, fire, are my daughters:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I tax not you, you elements, with unkindness;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I never gave you kingdom, call'd you children,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: You owe me no subscription: then let fall

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Your horrible pleasure: here I stand, your slave,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: A poor, infirm, weak, and despised old man:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: But yet I call you servile ministers,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That have with two pernicious daughters join'd

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Your high engender'd battles 'gainst a head

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: So old and white as this. O! O! 'tis foul!

speaker: Fool
text_entry: He that has a house to put's head in has a good

speaker: Fool
text_entry: head-piece.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: The cod-piece that will house

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Before the head has any,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: The head and he shall louse;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: So beggars marry many.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: The man that makes his toe

speaker: Fool
text_entry: What he his heart should make

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Shall of a corn cry woe,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: And turn his sleep to wake.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: For there was never yet fair woman but she made

speaker: Fool
text_entry: mouths in a glass.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No, I will be the pattern of all patience;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I will say nothing.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Enter KENT

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Who's there?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Marry, here's grace and a cod-piece; that's a wise

speaker: Fool
text_entry: man and a fool.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Alas, sir, are you here? things that love night

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Love not such nights as these; the wrathful skies

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Gallow the very wanderers of the dark,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: And make them keep their caves: since I was man,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Such sheets of fire, such bursts of horrid thunder,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Such groans of roaring wind and rain, I never

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Remember to have heard: man's nature cannot carry

speaker: KENT
text_entry: The affliction nor the fear.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Let the great gods,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That keep this dreadful pother o'er our heads,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Find out their enemies now. Tremble, thou wretch,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That hast within thee undivulged crimes,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Unwhipp'd of justice: hide thee, thou bloody hand;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thou perjured, and thou simular man of virtue

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That art incestuous: caitiff, to pieces shake,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That under covert and convenient seeming

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Hast practised on man's life: close pent-up guilts,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Rive your concealing continents, and cry

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: These dreadful summoners grace. I am a man

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: More sinn'd against than sinning.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Alack, bare-headed!

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Gracious my lord, hard by here is a hovel;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Some friendship will it lend you 'gainst the tempest:

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Repose you there; while I to this hard house--

speaker: KENT
text_entry: More harder than the stones whereof 'tis raised;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Which even but now, demanding after you,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Denied me to come in--return, and force

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Their scanted courtesy.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: My wits begin to turn.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Come on, my boy: how dost, my boy? art cold?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I am cold myself. Where is this straw, my fellow?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The art of our necessities is strange,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That can make vile things precious. Come,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: your hovel.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Poor fool and knave, I have one part in my heart

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That's sorry yet for thee.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: [Singing]

speaker: Fool
text_entry: He that has and a little tiny wit--

speaker: Fool
text_entry: With hey, ho, the wind and the rain,--

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Must make content with his fortunes fit,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: For the rain it raineth every day.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: True, my good boy. Come, bring us to this hovel.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Exeunt KING LEAR and KENT

speaker: Fool
text_entry: This is a brave night to cool a courtezan.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: I'll speak a prophecy ere I go:

speaker: Fool
text_entry: When priests are more in word than matter;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: When brewers mar their malt with water;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: When nobles are their tailors' tutors;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: No heretics burn'd, but wenches' suitors;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: When every case in law is right;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: No squire in debt, nor no poor knight;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: When slanders do not live in tongues;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Nor cutpurses come not to throngs;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: When usurers tell their gold i' the field;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: And bawds and whores do churches build;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Then shall the realm of Albion

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Come to great confusion:

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Then comes the time, who lives to see't,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: That going shall be used with feet.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: This prophecy Merlin shall make; for I live before his time.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Exit

speaker: Fool
text_entry: SCENE III. Gloucester's castle.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Enter GLOUCESTER and EDMUND

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Alack, alack, Edmund, I like not this unnatural

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: dealing. When I desire their leave that I might

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: pity him, they took from me the use of mine own

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: house; charged me, on pain of their perpetual

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: displeasure, neither to speak of him, entreat for

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: him, nor any way sustain him.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Most savage and unnatural!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Go to; say you nothing. There's a division betwixt

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: the dukes; and a worse matter than that: I have

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: received a letter this night; 'tis dangerous to be

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: spoken; I have locked the letter in my closet:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: these injuries the king now bears will be revenged

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: home; there's part of a power already footed: we

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: must incline to the king. I will seek him, and

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: privily relieve him: go you and maintain talk with

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: the duke, that my charity be not of him perceived:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: if he ask for me. I am ill, and gone to bed.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Though I die for it, as no less is threatened me,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: the king my old master must be relieved. There is

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: some strange thing toward, Edmund; pray you, be careful.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Exit

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: This courtesy, forbid thee, shall the duke

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Instantly know; and of that letter too:

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: This seems a fair deserving, and must draw me

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: That which my father loses; no less than all:

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: The younger rises when the old doth fall.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Exit

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: SCENE IV. The heath. Before a hovel.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Enter KING LEAR, KENT, and Fool

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Here is the place, my lord; good my lord, enter:

speaker: KENT
text_entry: The tyranny of the open night's too rough

speaker: KENT
text_entry: For nature to endure.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Storm still

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Let me alone.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Good my lord, enter here.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Wilt break my heart?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: I had rather break mine own. Good my lord, enter.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thou think'st 'tis much that this contentious storm

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Invades us to the skin: so 'tis to thee;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: But where the greater malady is fix'd,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The lesser is scarce felt. Thou'ldst shun a bear;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: But if thy flight lay toward the raging sea,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thou'ldst meet the bear i' the mouth. When the

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: mind's free,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The body's delicate: the tempest in my mind

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Doth from my senses take all feeling else

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Save what beats there. Filial ingratitude!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Is it not as this mouth should tear this hand

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: For lifting food to't? But I will punish home:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No, I will weep no more. In such a night

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To shut me out! Pour on; I will endure.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: In such a night as this! O Regan, Goneril!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Your old kind father, whose frank heart gave all,--

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: O, that way madness lies; let me shun that;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No more of that.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Good my lord, enter here.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Prithee, go in thyself: seek thine own ease:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: This tempest will not give me leave to ponder

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: On things would hurt me more. But I'll go in.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To the Fool

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: In, boy; go first. You houseless poverty,--

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Nay, get thee in. I'll pray, and then I'll sleep.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Fool goes in

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Poor naked wretches, whereso'er you are,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That bide the pelting of this pitiless storm,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: How shall your houseless heads and unfed sides,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Your loop'd and window'd raggedness, defend you

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: From seasons such as these? O, I have ta'en

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Too little care of this! Take physic, pomp;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Expose thyself to feel what wretches feel,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That thou mayst shake the superflux to them,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And show the heavens more just.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: [Within]  Fathom and half, fathom and half! Poor Tom!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: The Fool runs out from the hovel

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Come not in here, nuncle, here's a spirit

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Help me, help me!

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Give me thy hand. Who's there?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: A spirit, a spirit: he says his name's poor Tom.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: What art thou that dost grumble there i' the straw?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Come forth.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Enter EDGAR disguised as a mad man

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Away! the foul fiend follows me!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Through the sharp hawthorn blows the cold wind.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Hum! go to thy cold bed, and warm thee.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Hast thou given all to thy two daughters?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And art thou come to this?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Who gives any thing to poor Tom? whom the foul

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: fiend hath led through fire and through flame, and

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: through ford and whirlipool e'er bog and quagmire;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: that hath laid knives under his pillow, and halters

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: in his pew; set ratsbane by his porridge; made film

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: proud of heart, to ride on a bay trotting-horse over

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: four-inched bridges, to course his own shadow for a

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: traitor. Bless thy five wits! Tom's a-cold,--O, do

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: de, do de, do de. Bless thee from whirlwinds,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: star-blasting, and taking! Do poor Tom some

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: charity, whom the foul fiend vexes: there could I

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: have him now,--and there,--and there again, and there.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Storm still

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What, have his daughters brought him to this pass?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Couldst thou save nothing? Didst thou give them all?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Nay, he reserved a blanket, else we had been all shamed.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Now, all the plagues that in the pendulous air

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Hang fated o'er men's faults light on thy daughters!

speaker: KENT
text_entry: He hath no daughters, sir.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Death, traitor! nothing could have subdued nature

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To such a lowness but his unkind daughters.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Is it the fashion, that discarded fathers

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Should have thus little mercy on their flesh?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Judicious punishment! 'twas this flesh begot

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Those pelican daughters.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Pillicock sat on Pillicock-hill:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Halloo, halloo, loo, loo!

speaker: Fool
text_entry: This cold night will turn us all to fools and madmen.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Take heed o' the foul fiend: obey thy parents;

speaker: EDGAR

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: man's sworn spouse; set not thy sweet heart on proud

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: array. Tom's a-cold.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What hast thou been?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: A serving-man, proud in heart and mind; that curled

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: my hair; wore gloves in my cap; served the lust of

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: my mistress' heart, and did the act of darkness with

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: her; swore as many oaths as I spake words, and

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: broke them in the sweet face of heaven: one that

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: slept in the contriving of lust, and waked to do it:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: wine loved I deeply, dice dearly: and in woman

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: out-paramoured the Turk: false of heart, light of

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: ear, bloody of hand; hog in sloth, fox in stealth,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: wolf in greediness, dog in madness, lion in prey.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Let not the creaking of shoes nor the rustling of

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: silks betray thy poor heart to woman: keep thy foot

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: out of brothels, thy hand out of plackets, thy pen

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: from lenders' books, and defy the foul fiend.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Still through the hawthorn blows the cold wind:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Says suum, mun, ha, no, nonny.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Dolphin my boy, my boy, sessa! let him trot by.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Storm still

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Why, thou wert better in thy grave than to answer

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: with thy uncovered body this extremity of the skies.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Is man no more than this? Consider him well. Thou

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: owest the worm no silk, the beast no hide, the sheep

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: no wool, the cat no perfume. Ha! here's three on

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: 's are sophisticated! Thou art the thing itself:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: unaccommodated man is no more but such a poor bare,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: forked animal as thou art. Off, off, you lendings!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: come unbutton here.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Tearing off his clothes

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Prithee, nuncle, be contented; 'tis a naughty night

speaker: Fool
text_entry: to swim in. Now a little fire in a wild field were

speaker: Fool
text_entry: like an old lecher's heart; a small spark, all the

speaker: Fool
text_entry: rest on's body cold. Look, here comes a walking fire.

text_entry: Enter GLOUCESTER, with a torch

text_entry: This is the foul fiend Flibbertigibbet: he begins

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: at curfew, and walks till the first cock; he gives

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: the web and the pin, squints the eye, and makes the

text_entry: hare-lip; mildews the white wheat, and hurts the

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: poor creature of earth.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: S. Withold footed thrice the old;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: He met the night-mare, and her nine-fold;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Bid her alight,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: And her troth plight,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: And, aroint thee, witch, aroint thee!

speaker: KENT
text_entry: How fares your grace?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What's he?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Who's there? What is't you seek?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: What are you there? Your names?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Poor Tom; that eats the swimming frog, the toad,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: the tadpole, the wall-newt and the water; that in

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: the fury of his heart, when the foul fiend rages,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: eats cow-dung for sallets; swallows the old rat and

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: the ditch-dog; drinks the green mantle of the

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: standing pool; who is whipped from tithing to

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: tithing, and stock- punished, and imprisoned; who

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: hath had three suits to his back, six shirts to his

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: body, horse to ride, and weapon to wear;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: But mice and rats, and such small deer,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Have been Tom's food for seven long year.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Beware my follower. Peace, Smulkin; peace, thou fiend!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: What, hath your grace no better company?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: The prince of darkness is a gentleman:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Modo he's call'd, and Mahu.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Our flesh and blood is grown so vile, my lord,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: That it doth hate what gets it.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Poor Tom's a-cold.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Go in with me: my duty cannot suffer

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To obey in all your daughters' hard commands:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Though their injunction be to bar my doors,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And let this tyrannous night take hold upon you,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Yet have I ventured to come seek you out,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And bring you where both fire and food is ready.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: First let me talk with this philosopher.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What is the cause of thunder?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Good my lord, take his offer; go into the house.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I'll talk a word with this same learned Theban.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What is your study?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: How to prevent the fiend, and to kill vermin.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Let me ask you one word in private.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Importune him once more to go, my lord;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: His wits begin to unsettle.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Canst thou blame him?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Storm still

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: His daughters seek his death: ah, that good Kent!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: He said it would be thus, poor banish'd man!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Thou say'st the king grows mad; I'll tell thee, friend,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I am almost mad myself: I had a son,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Now outlaw'd from my blood; he sought my life,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: But lately, very late: I loved him, friend;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: No father his son dearer: truth to tell thee,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: The grief hath crazed my wits. What a night's this!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I do beseech your grace,--

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: O, cry your mercy, sir.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Noble philosopher, your company.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Tom's a-cold.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: In, fellow, there, into the hovel: keep thee warm.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Come let's in all.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: This way, my lord.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: With him;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I will keep still with my philosopher.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Good my lord, soothe him; let him take the fellow.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Take him you on.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Sirrah, come on; go along with us.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Come, good Athenian.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: No words, no words: hush.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Child Rowland to the dark tower came,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: His word was still,--Fie, foh, and fum,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: I smell the blood of a British man.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: SCENE V. Gloucester's castle.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Enter CORNWALL and EDMUND

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: I will have my revenge ere I depart his house.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: How, my lord, I may be censured, that nature thus

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: gives way to loyalty, something fears me to think

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: of.

text_entry: I now perceive, it was not altogether your

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: brother's evil disposition made him seek his death;

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: but a provoking merit, set a-work by a reprovable

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: badness in himself.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: How malicious is my fortune, that I must repent to

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: be just! This is the letter he spoke of, which

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: approves him an intelligent party to the advantages

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: of France: O heavens! that this treason were not,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: or not I the detector!

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: o with me to the duchess.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: mighty business in hand.

text_entry: True or false, it hath made thee earl of

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Gloucester. Seek out where thy father is, that he

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: may be ready for our apprehension.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: [Aside]  If I find him comforting the king, it will

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: stuff his suspicion more fully.--I will persevere in

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: my course of loyalty, though the conflict be sore

speaker: EDMUND

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: I will lay trust upon thee; and thou shalt find a

speaker: CORNWALL

text_entry: addition I can: I will not be long from you.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: before him.

text_entry: To have a thousand with red burning spits

text_entry: you are o' the commission,

text_entry: False justicer, why hast thou let her 'scape?

text_entry: Bless thy five wits!

speaker: KENT
text_entry: O pity! Sir, where is the patience now,

text_entry: The little dogs and all, Tray, Blanch, and

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Be thy mouth or black or white,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Tooth that poisons if it bite;

text_entry: Mastiff, grey-hound, mongrel grim,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Hound or spaniel, brach or lym,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Or bobtail tike or trundle-tail,

text_entry: Tom will make them weep and wail:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: For, with throwing thus my head,

text_entry: Dogs leap the hatch, and all are fled.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Do de, de, de. Sessa! Come, march to wakes and

text_entry: You, sir, I entertain for one of my hundred; only I

text_entry: do not like the fashion of your garments: you will

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: say they are Persian attire: but let them be changed.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Now, good my lord, lie here and rest awhile.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Make no noise, make no noise; draw the curtains:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: so, so, so. We'll go to supper i' he morning. So, so, so.

text_entry: And I'll go to bed at noon.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Come hither, friend: where is the king my master?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Here, sir; but trouble him not, his wits are gone.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Good friend, I prithee, take him in thy arms;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I have o'erheard a plot of death upon him:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: There is a litter ready; lay him in 't,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And drive towards Dover, friend, where thou shalt meet

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Both welcome and protection. Take up thy master:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: If thou shouldst dally half an hour, his life,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: With thine, and all that offer to defend him,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Stand in assured loss: take up, take up;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And follow me, that will to some provision

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Give thee quick conduct.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Oppressed nature sleeps:

speaker: KENT
text_entry: This rest might yet have balm'd thy broken senses,

text_entry: Which, if convenience will not allow,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Stand in hard cure.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: To the Fool

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Come, help to bear thy master;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Thou must not stay behind.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Come, come, away.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Exeunt all but EDGAR

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: When we our betters see bearing our woes,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: We scarcely think our miseries our foes.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Who alone suffers suffers most i' the mind,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Leaving free things and happy shows behind:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: But then the mind much sufferance doth o'er skip,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: When grief hath mates, and bearing fellowship.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: How light and portable my pain seems now,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: When that which makes me bend makes the king bow,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: He childed as I father'd! Tom, away!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Mark the high noises; and thyself bewray,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: When false opinion, whose wrong thought defiles thee,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: In thy just proof, repeals and reconciles thee.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: What will hap more to-night, safe 'scape the king!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Lurk, lurk.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Exit

speaker: EDGAR

text_entry: like. Our posts shall be swift and intelligent

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Go seek the traitor Gloucester,

speaker: CORNWALL

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Though well we may not pass upon his life

text_entry: Without the form of justice, yet our power

text_entry: Shall do a courtesy to our wrath, which men

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: May blame, but not control. Who's there? the traitor?

text_entry: Enter GLOUCESTER, brought in by two or three

text_entry: Ingrateful fox! 'tis he.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Bind fast his corky arms.

text_entry: What mean your graces? Good my friends, consider

text_entry: You are my guests: do me no foul play, friends.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Servants bind him

text_entry: Unmerciful lady as you are, I'm none.

text_entry: To this chair bind him. Villain, thou shalt find--

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: REGAN plucks his beard

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: By the kind gods, 'tis most ignobly done

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To pluck me by the beard.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: So white, and such a traitor!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Naughty lady,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: These hairs, which thou dost ravish from my chin,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Will quicken, and accuse thee: I am your host:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: With robbers' hands my hospitable favours

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: You should not ruffle thus. What will you do?

text_entry: Come, sir, what letters had you late from France?

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Be simple answerer, for we know the truth.

text_entry: And what confederacy have you with the traitors
