text_entry: Late footed in the kingdom?

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: To whose hands have you sent the lunatic king? Speak.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I have a letter guessingly set down,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Which came from one that's of a neutral heart,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And not from one opposed.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Cunning.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: And false.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Where hast thou sent the king?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To Dover.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Wherefore to Dover? Wast thou not charged at peril--

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Wherefore to Dover? Let him first answer that.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I am tied to the stake, and I must stand the course.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Wherefore to Dover, sir?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Because I would not see thy cruel nails

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Pluck out his poor old eyes; nor thy fierce sister

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: In his anointed flesh stick boarish fangs.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: The sea, with such a storm as his bare head

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: In hell-black night endured, would have buoy'd up,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And quench'd the stelled fires:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Yet, poor old heart, he holp the heavens to rain.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: If wolves had at thy gate howl'd that stern time,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Thou shouldst have said 'Good porter, turn the key,'

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: All cruels else subscribed: but I shall see

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: The winged vengeance overtake such children.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: See't shalt thou never. Fellows, hold the chair.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Upon these eyes of thine I'll set my foot.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: He that will think to live till he be old,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Give me some help! O cruel! O you gods!

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: One side will mock another; the other too.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: If you see vengeance,--

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: Hold your hand, my lord:

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: I have served you ever since I was a child;

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: But better service have I never done you

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: Than now to bid you hold.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: How now, you dog!

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: If you did wear a beard upon your chin,

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: I'd shake it on this quarrel. What do you mean?

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: My villain!

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: They draw and fight

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: Nay, then, come on, and take the chance of anger.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Give me thy sword. A peasant stand up thus!

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Takes a sword, and runs at him behind

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: O, I am slain! My lord, you have one eye left

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: To see some mischief on him. O!

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: Dies

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Lest it see more, prevent it. Out, vile jelly!

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Where is thy lustre now?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: All dark and comfortless. Where's my son Edmund?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Edmund, enkindle all the sparks of nature,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To quit this horrid act.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Out, treacherous villain!

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Thou call'st on him that hates thee: it was he

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: That made the overture of thy treasons to us;

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Who is too good to pity thee.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: O my follies! then Edgar was abused.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Kind gods, forgive me that, and prosper him!

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Go thrust him out at gates, and let him smell

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: His way to Dover.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Exit one with GLOUCESTER

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: How is't, my lord? how look you?

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: I have received a hurt: follow me, lady.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Turn out that eyeless villain; throw this slave

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Upon the dunghill. Regan, I bleed apace:

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Untimely comes this hurt: give me your arm.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Exit CORNWALL, led by REGAN

speaker: Second Servant
text_entry: I'll never care what wickedness I do,

speaker: Second Servant
text_entry: If this man come to good.

speaker: Third Servant
text_entry: If she live long,

speaker: Third Servant
text_entry: And in the end meet the old course of death,

speaker: Third Servant
text_entry: Women will all turn monsters.

speaker: Second Servant
text_entry: Let's follow the old earl, and get the Bedlam

speaker: Second Servant
text_entry: To lead him where he would: his roguish madness

speaker: Second Servant
text_entry: Allows itself to any thing.

speaker: Third Servant
text_entry: Go thou: I'll fetch some flax and whites of eggs

speaker: Third Servant
text_entry: To apply to his bleeding face. Now, heaven help him!

speaker: Third Servant
text_entry: Exeunt severally

speaker: Third Servant
text_entry: ACT IV

speaker: Third Servant
text_entry: SCENE I. The heath.

speaker: Third Servant
text_entry: Enter EDGAR

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Yet better thus, and known to be contemn'd,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Than still contemn'd and flatter'd. To be worst,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: The lowest and most dejected thing of fortune,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Stands still in esperance, lives not in fear:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: The lamentable change is from the best;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: The worst returns to laughter. Welcome, then,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Thou unsubstantial air that I embrace!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: The wretch that thou hast blown unto the worst

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Owes nothing to thy blasts. But who comes here?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Enter GLOUCESTER, led by an Old Man

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: My father, poorly led? World, world, O world!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: But that thy strange mutations make us hate thee,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Lie would not yield to age.

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: O, my good lord, I have been your tenant, and

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: your father's tenant, these fourscore years.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Away, get thee away; good friend, be gone:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Thy comforts can do me no good at all;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Thee they may hurt.

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: Alack, sir, you cannot see your way.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I have no way, and therefore want no eyes;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I stumbled when I saw: full oft 'tis seen,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Our means secure us, and our mere defects

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Prove our commodities. O dear son Edgar,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: The food of thy abused father's wrath!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Might I but live to see thee in my touch,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I'ld say I had eyes again!

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: How now! Who's there?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: [Aside]  O gods! Who is't can say 'I am at

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: the worst'?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: I am worse than e'er I was.

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: 'Tis poor mad Tom.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: [Aside]  And worse I may be yet: the worst is not

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: So long as we can say  'This is the worst.'

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: Fellow, where goest?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Is it a beggar-man?

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: Madman and beggar too.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: He has some reason, else he could not beg.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I' the last night's storm I such a fellow saw;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Which made me think a man a worm: my son

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Came then into my mind; and yet my mind

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Was then scarce friends with him: I have heard

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: more since.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: As flies to wanton boys, are we to the gods.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: They kill us for their sport.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: [Aside] How should this be?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Bad is the trade that must play fool to sorrow,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Angering itself and others.--Bless thee, master!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Is that the naked fellow?

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: Ay, my lord.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Then, prithee, get thee gone: if, for my sake,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Thou wilt o'ertake us, hence a mile or twain,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I' the way toward Dover, do it for ancient love;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And bring some covering for this naked soul,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Who I'll entreat to lead me.

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: Alack, sir, he is mad.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: 'Tis the times' plague, when madmen lead the blind.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Do as I bid thee, or rather do thy pleasure;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Above the rest, be gone.

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: I'll bring him the best 'parel that I have,

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: Come on't what will.

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: Exit

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Sirrah, naked fellow,--

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Poor Tom's a-cold.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Aside

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: I cannot daub it further.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Come hither, fellow.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: [Aside]  And yet I must.--Bless thy sweet eyes, they bleed.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Know'st thou the way to Dover?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Both stile and gate, horse-way and foot-path. Poor

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Tom hath been scared out of his good wits: bless

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: thee, good man's son, from the foul fiend! five

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: fiends have been in poor Tom at once; of lust, as

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Obidicut; Hobbididence, prince of dumbness; Mahu, of

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: stealing; Modo, of murder; Flibbertigibbet, of

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: mopping and mowing, who since possesses chambermaids

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: and waiting-women. So, bless thee, master!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Here, take this purse, thou whom the heavens' plagues

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Have humbled to all strokes: that I am wretched

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Makes thee the happier: heavens, deal so still!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Let the superfluous and lust-dieted man,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: That slaves your ordinance, that will not see

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Because he doth not feel, feel your power quickly;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: So distribution should undo excess,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And each man have enough. Dost thou know Dover?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Ay, master.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: There is a cliff, whose high and bending head

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Looks fearfully in the confined deep:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Bring me but to the very brim of it,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And I'll repair the misery thou dost bear

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: With something rich about me: from that place

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I shall no leading need.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Give me thy arm:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Poor Tom shall lead thee.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: SCENE II. Before ALBANY's palace.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Enter GONERIL and EDMUND

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Welcome, my lord: I marvel our mild husband

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Not met us on the way.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Enter OSWALD

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Now, where's your master'?

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Madam, within; but never man so changed.

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: I told him of the army that was landed;

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: He smiled at it: I told him you were coming:

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: His answer was 'The worse:' of Gloucester's treachery,

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: And of the loyal service of his son,

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: When I inform'd him, then he call'd me sot,

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: And told me I had turn'd the wrong side out:

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: What most he should dislike seems pleasant to him;

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: What like, offensive.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: [To EDMUND]  Then shall you go no further.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: It is the cowish terror of his spirit,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: That dares not undertake: he'll not feel wrongs

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Which tie him to an answer. Our wishes on the way

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: May prove effects. Back, Edmund, to my brother;

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Hasten his musters and conduct his powers:

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: I must change arms at home, and give the distaff

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Into my husband's hands. This trusty servant

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Shall pass between us: ere long you are like to hear,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: If you dare venture in your own behalf,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: A mistress's command. Wear this; spare speech;

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Giving a favour

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Decline your head: this kiss, if it durst speak,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Would stretch thy spirits up into the air:

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Conceive, and fare thee well.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Yours in the ranks of death.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: My most dear Gloucester!

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Exit EDMUND

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: O, the difference of man and man!

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: To thee a woman's services are due:

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: My fool usurps my body.

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Madam, here comes my lord.

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Exit

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Enter ALBANY

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: I have been worth the whistle.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: O Goneril!

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: You are not worth the dust which the rude wind

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Blows in your face. I fear your disposition:

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: That nature, which contemns its origin,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Cannot be border'd certain in itself;

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: She that herself will sliver and disbranch

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: From her material sap, perforce must wither

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: And come to deadly use.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: No more; the text is foolish.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Wisdom and goodness to the vile seem vile:

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Filths savour but themselves. What have you done?

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Tigers, not daughters, what have you perform'd?

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: A father, and a gracious aged man,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Whose reverence even the head-lugg'd bear would lick,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Most barbarous, most degenerate! have you madded.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Could my good brother suffer you to do it?

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: A man, a prince, by him so benefited!

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: If that the heavens do not their visible spirits

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Send quickly down to tame these vile offences,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: It will come,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Humanity must perforce prey on itself,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Like monsters of the deep.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Milk-liver'd man!

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: That bear'st a cheek for blows, a head for wrongs;

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Who hast not in thy brows an eye discerning

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Thine honour from thy suffering; that not know'st

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Fools do those villains pity who are punish'd

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Ere they have done their mischief. Where's thy drum?

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: France spreads his banners in our noiseless land;

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: With plumed helm thy slayer begins threats;

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Whiles thou, a moral fool, sit'st still, and criest

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: 'Alack, why does he so?'

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: See thyself, devil!

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Proper deformity seems not in the fiend

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: So horrid as in woman.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: O vain fool!

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Thou changed and self-cover'd thing, for shame,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Be-monster not thy feature. Were't my fitness

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: To let these hands obey my blood,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: They are apt enough to dislocate and tear

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Thy flesh and bones: howe'er thou art a fiend,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: A woman's shape doth shield thee.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Marry, your manhood now--

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Enter a Messenger

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: What news?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: O, my good lord, the Duke of Cornwall's dead:

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Slain by his servant, going to put out

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: The other eye of Gloucester.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Gloucester's eye!

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: A servant that he bred, thrill'd with remorse,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Opposed against the act, bending his sword

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: To his great master; who, thereat enraged,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Flew on him, and amongst them fell'd him dead;

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: But not without that harmful stroke, which since

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Hath pluck'd him after.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: This shows you are above,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: You justicers, that these our nether crimes

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: So speedily can venge! But, O poor Gloucester!

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Lost he his other eye?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Both, both, my lord.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: This letter, madam, craves a speedy answer;

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: 'Tis from your sister.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: [Aside]              One way I like this well;

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: But being widow, and my Gloucester with her,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: May all the building in my fancy pluck

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Upon my hateful life: another way,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: The news is not so tart.--I'll read, and answer.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Exit

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Where was his son when they did take his eyes?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Come with my lady hither.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: He is not here.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: No, my good lord; I met him back again.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Knows he the wickedness?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Ay, my good lord; 'twas he inform'd against him;

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: And quit the house on purpose, that their punishment

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Might have the freer course.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Gloucester, I live

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: To thank thee for the love thou show'dst the king,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: And to revenge thine eyes. Come hither, friend:

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Tell me what more thou know'st.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: SCENE III. The French camp near Dover.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Enter KENT and a Gentleman

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Why the King of France is so suddenly gone back

speaker: KENT
text_entry: know you the reason?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Something he left imperfect in the

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: state, which since his coming forth is thought

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: of; which imports to the kingdom so much

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: fear and danger, that his personal return was

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: most required and necessary.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Who hath he left behind him general?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: The Marshal of France, Monsieur La Far.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Did your letters pierce the queen to any

speaker: KENT
text_entry: demonstration of grief?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Ay, sir; she took them, read them in my presence;

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: And now and then an ample tear trill'd down

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Her delicate cheek: it seem'd she was a queen

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Over her passion; who, most rebel-like,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Sought to be king o'er her.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: O, then it moved her.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Not to a rage: patience and sorrow strove

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Who should express her goodliest. You have seen

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Sunshine and rain at once: her smiles and tears

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Were like a better way: those happy smilets,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: That play'd on her ripe lip, seem'd not to know

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: What guests were in her eyes; which parted thence,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: As pearls from diamonds dropp'd. In brief,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Sorrow would be a rarity most beloved,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: If all could so become it.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Made she no verbal question?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: 'Faith, once or twice she heaved the name of 'father'

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Pantingly forth, as if it press'd her heart:

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Cried 'Sisters! sisters! Shame of ladies! sisters!

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Kent! father! sisters! What, i' the storm? i' the night?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Let pity not be believed!' There she shook

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: The holy water from her heavenly eyes,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: And clamour moisten'd: then away she started

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: To deal with grief alone.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: It is the stars,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: The stars above us, govern our conditions;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Else one self mate and mate could not beget

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Such different issues. You spoke not with her since?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: No.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Was this before the king return'd?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: No, since.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Well, sir, the poor distressed Lear's i' the town;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Who sometime, in his better tune, remembers

speaker: KENT
text_entry: What we are come about, and by no means

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Will yield to see his daughter.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Why, good sir?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: A sovereign shame so elbows him: his own unkindness,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: That stripp'd her from his benediction, turn'd her

speaker: KENT
text_entry: To foreign casualties, gave her dear rights

speaker: KENT
text_entry: To his dog-hearted daughters, these things sting

speaker: KENT
text_entry: His mind so venomously, that burning shame

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Detains him from Cordelia.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Alack, poor gentleman!

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Of Albany's and Cornwall's powers you heard not?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: 'Tis so, they are afoot.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Well, sir, I'll bring you to our master Lear,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: And leave you to attend him: some dear cause

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Will in concealment wrap me up awhile;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: When I am known aright, you shall not grieve

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Lending me this acquaintance. I pray you, go

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Along with me.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: KENT
text_entry: SCENE IV. The same. A tent.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Enter, with drum and colours, CORDELIA, Doctor, and Soldiers

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Alack, 'tis he: why, he was met even now

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: As mad as the vex'd sea; singing aloud;

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Crown'd with rank fumiter and furrow-weeds,

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: With bur-docks, hemlock, nettles, cuckoo-flowers,

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Darnel, and all the idle weeds that grow

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: In our sustaining corn. A century send forth;

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Search every acre in the high-grown field,

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: And bring him to our eye.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Exit an Officer

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: What can man's wisdom

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: In the restoring his bereaved sense?

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: He that helps him take all my outward worth.

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: There is means, madam:

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Our foster-nurse of nature is repose,

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: The which he lacks; that to provoke in him,

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Are many simples operative, whose power

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Will close the eye of anguish.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: All blest secrets,

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: All you unpublish'd virtues of the earth,

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Spring with my tears! be aidant and remediate

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: In the good man's distress! Seek, seek for him;

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Lest his ungovern'd rage dissolve the life

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: That wants the means to lead it.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Enter a Messenger

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: News, madam;

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: The British powers are marching hitherward.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: 'Tis known before; our preparation stands

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: In expectation of them. O dear father,

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: It is thy business that I go about;

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Therefore great France

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: My mourning and important tears hath pitied.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: No blown ambition doth our arms incite,

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: But love, dear love, and our aged father's right:

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Soon may I hear and see him!

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: SCENE V. Gloucester's castle.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Enter REGAN and OSWALD

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: But are my brother's powers set forth?

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Ay, madam.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Himself in person there?

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Madam, with much ado:

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Your sister is the better soldier.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Lord Edmund spake not with your lord at home?

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: No, madam.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: What might import my sister's letter to him?

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: I know not, lady.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: 'Faith, he is posted hence on serious matter.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: It was great ignorance, Gloucester's eyes being out,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: To let him live: where he arrives he moves

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: All hearts against us: Edmund, I think, is gone,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: In pity of his misery, to dispatch

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: His nighted life: moreover, to descry

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: The strength o' the enemy.

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: I must needs after him, madam, with my letter.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Our troops set forth to-morrow: stay with us;

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: The ways are dangerous.

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: I may not, madam:

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: My lady charged my duty in this business.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Why should she write to Edmund? Might not you

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Transport her purposes by word? Belike,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Something--I know not what: I'll love thee much,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Let me unseal the letter.

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Madam, I had rather--

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: I know your lady does not love her husband;

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: I am sure of that: and at her late being here

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: She gave strange oeillades and most speaking looks

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: To noble Edmund. I know you are of her bosom.

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: I, madam?

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: I speak in understanding; you are; I know't:

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Therefore I do advise you, take this note:

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: My lord is dead; Edmund and I have talk'd;

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: And more convenient is he for my hand

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Than for your lady's: you may gather more.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: If you do find him, pray you, give him this;

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: And when your mistress hears thus much from you,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: I pray, desire her call her wisdom to her.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: So, fare you well.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: If you do chance to hear of that blind traitor,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Preferment falls on him that cuts him off.

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Would I could meet him, madam! I should show

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: What party I do follow.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Fare thee well.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: SCENE VI. Fields near Dover.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Enter GLOUCESTER, and EDGAR dressed like a peasant

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: When shall we come to the top of that same hill?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: You do climb up it now: look, how we labour.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Methinks the ground is even.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Horrible steep.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Hark, do you hear the sea?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: No, truly.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Why, then, your other senses grow imperfect

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: By your eyes' anguish.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: So may it be, indeed:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Methinks thy voice is alter'd; and thou speak'st

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: In better phrase and matter than thou didst.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: You're much deceived: in nothing am I changed

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: But in my garments.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Methinks you're better spoken.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Come on, sir; here's the place: stand still. How fearful

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: And dizzy 'tis, to cast one's eyes so low!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: The crows and choughs that wing the midway air

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Show scarce so gross as beetles: half way down

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Hangs one that gathers samphire, dreadful trade!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Methinks he seems no bigger than his head:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: The fishermen, that walk upon the beach,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Appear like mice; and yond tall anchoring bark,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Diminish'd to her cock; her cock, a buoy

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Almost too small for sight: the murmuring surge,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: That on the unnumber'd idle pebbles chafes,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Cannot be heard so high. I'll look no more;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Lest my brain turn, and the deficient sight

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Topple down headlong.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Set me where you stand.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Give me your hand: you are now within a foot

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Of the extreme verge: for all beneath the moon

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Would I not leap upright.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Let go my hand.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Here, friend, 's another purse; in it a jewel

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Well worth a poor man's taking: fairies and gods

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Prosper it with thee! Go thou farther off;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Bid me farewell, and let me hear thee going.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Now fare you well, good sir.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: With all my heart.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Why I do trifle thus with his despair

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Is done to cure it.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: [Kneeling]  O you mighty gods!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: This world I do renounce, and, in your sights,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Shake patiently my great affliction off:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: If I could bear it longer, and not fall

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To quarrel with your great opposeless wills,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: My snuff and loathed part of nature should

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Burn itself out. If Edgar live, O, bless him!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Now, fellow, fare thee well.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: He falls forward

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Gone, sir: farewell.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: And yet I know not how conceit may rob

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: The treasury of life, when life itself

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Yields to the theft: had he been where he thought,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: By this, had thought been past. Alive or dead?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Ho, you sir! friend! Hear you, sir! speak!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Thus might he pass indeed: yet he revives.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: What are you, sir?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Away, and let me die.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Hadst thou been aught but gossamer, feathers, air,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: So many fathom down precipitating,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Thou'dst shiver'd like an egg: but thou dost breathe;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Hast heavy substance; bleed'st not; speak'st; art sound.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Ten masts at each make not the altitude

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Which thou hast perpendicularly fell:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Thy life's a miracle. Speak yet again.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: But have I fall'n, or no?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: From the dread summit of this chalky bourn.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Look up a-height; the shrill-gorged lark so far

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Cannot be seen or heard: do but look up.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Alack, I have no eyes.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Is wretchedness deprived that benefit,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To end itself by death? 'Twas yet some comfort,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: When misery could beguile the tyrant's rage,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And frustrate his proud will.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Give me your arm:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Up: so. How is 't? Feel you your legs? You stand.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Too well, too well.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: This is above all strangeness.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Upon the crown o' the cliff, what thing was that

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Which parted from you?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: A poor unfortunate beggar.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: As I stood here below, methought his eyes

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Were two full moons; he had a thousand noses,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Horns whelk'd and waved like the enridged sea:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: It was some fiend; therefore, thou happy father,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Think that the clearest gods, who make them honours

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Of men's impossibilities, have preserved thee.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I do remember now: henceforth I'll bear

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Affliction till it do cry out itself

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: 'Enough, enough,' and die. That thing you speak of,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I took it for a man; often 'twould say

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: 'The fiend, the fiend:' he led me to that place.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Bear free and patient thoughts. But who comes here?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Enter KING LEAR, fantastically dressed with wild flowers

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: The safer sense will ne'er accommodate

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: His master thus.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No, they cannot touch me for coining; I am the

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: king himself.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: O thou side-piercing sight!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Nature's above art in that respect. There's your

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: press-money. That fellow handles his bow like a

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: crow-keeper: draw me a clothier's yard. Look,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: look, a mouse! Peace, peace; this piece of toasted

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: cheese will do 't. There's my gauntlet; I'll prove

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: it on a giant. Bring up the brown bills. O, well

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: flown, bird! i' the clout, i' the clout: hewgh!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Give the word.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Sweet marjoram.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Pass.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I know that voice.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Ha! Goneril, with a white beard! They flattered

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: me like a dog; and told me I had white hairs in my

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: beard ere the black ones were there. To say 'ay'

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: and 'no' to every thing that I said!--'Ay' and 'no'

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: too was no good divinity. When the rain came to

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: wet me once, and the wind to make me chatter; when

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: the thunder would not peace at my bidding; there I

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: found 'em, there I smelt 'em out. Go to, they are

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: not men o' their words: they told me I was every

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: thing; 'tis a lie, I am not ague-proof.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: The trick of that voice I do well remember:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Is 't not the king?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Ay, every inch a king:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: When I do stare, see how the subject quakes.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I pardon that man's life. What was thy cause? Adultery?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thou shalt not die: die for adultery! No:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The wren goes to 't, and the small gilded fly

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Does lecher in my sight.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Let copulation thrive; for Gloucester's bastard son

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Was kinder to his father than my daughters

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Got 'tween the lawful sheets.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To 't, luxury, pell-mell! for I lack soldiers.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Behold yond simpering dame,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Whose face between her forks presages snow;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That minces virtue, and does shake the head

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To hear of pleasure's name;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The fitchew, nor the soiled horse, goes to 't

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: With a more riotous appetite.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Down from the waist they are Centaurs,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Though women all above:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: But to the girdle do the gods inherit,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Beneath is all the fiends';

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: There's hell, there's darkness, there's the

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: sulphurous pit,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Burning, scalding, stench, consumption; fie,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: fie, fie! pah, pah! Give me an ounce of civet,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: good apothecary, to sweeten my imagination:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: there's money for thee.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: O, let me kiss that hand!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Let me wipe it first; it smells of mortality.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: O ruin'd piece of nature! This great world

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Shall so wear out to nought. Dost thou know me?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I remember thine eyes well enough. Dost thou squiny

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: at me? No, do thy worst, blind Cupid! I'll not

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: love. Read thou this challenge; mark but the

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: penning of it.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Were all the letters suns, I could not see one.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: I would not take this from report; it is,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: And my heart breaks at it.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Read.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: What, with the case of eyes?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: O, ho, are you there with me? No eyes in your

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: head, nor no money in your purse? Your eyes are in

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: a heavy case, your purse in a light; yet you see how

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: this world goes.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I see it feelingly.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What, art mad? A man may see how this world goes

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: with no eyes. Look with thine ears: see how yond

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: justice rails upon yond simple thief. Hark, in

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: thine ear: change places; and, handy-dandy, which

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: is the justice, which is the thief? Thou hast seen

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: a farmer's dog bark at a beggar?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Ay, sir.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And the creature run from the cur? There thou

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: mightst behold the great image of authority: a

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: dog's obeyed in office.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thou rascal beadle, hold thy bloody hand!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Why dost thou lash that whore? Strip thine own back;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thou hotly lust'st to use her in that kind

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: For which thou whipp'st her. The usurer hangs the cozener.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Through tatter'd clothes small vices do appear;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Robes and furr'd gowns hide all. Plate sin with gold,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And the strong lance of justice hurtless breaks:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Arm it in rags, a pigmy's straw does pierce it.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: None does offend, none, I say, none; I'll able 'em:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Take that of me, my friend, who have the power

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To seal the accuser's lips. Get thee glass eyes;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And like a scurvy politician, seem

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To see the things thou dost not. Now, now, now, now:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Pull off my boots: harder, harder: so.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: O, matter and impertinency mix'd! Reason in madness!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: If thou wilt weep my fortunes, take my eyes.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I know thee well enough; thy name is Gloucester:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thou must be patient; we came crying hither:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thou know'st, the first time that we smell the air,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: We wawl and cry. I will preach to thee: mark.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Alack, alack the day!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: When we are born, we cry that we are come

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To this great stage of fools: this a good block;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: It were a delicate stratagem, to shoe

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: A troop of horse with felt: I'll put 't in proof;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And when I have stol'n upon these sons-in-law,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Then, kill, kill, kill, kill, kill, kill!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Enter a Gentleman, with Attendants

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: O, here he is: lay hand upon him. Sir,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Your most dear daughter--

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No rescue? What, a prisoner? I am even

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The natural fool of fortune. Use me well;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: You shall have ransom. Let me have surgeons;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I am cut to the brains.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: You shall have any thing.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No seconds? all myself?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Why, this would make a man a man of salt,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To use his eyes for garden water-pots,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Ay, and laying autumn's dust.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Good sir,--

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I will die bravely, like a bridegroom. What!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I will be jovial: come, come; I am a king,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: My masters, know you that.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: You are a royal one, and we obey you.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Then there's life in't. Nay, if you get it, you

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: shall get it with running. Sa, sa, sa, sa.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Exit running; Attendants follow

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: A sight most pitiful in the meanest wretch,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Past speaking of in a king! Thou hast one daughter,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Who redeems nature from the general curse

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Which twain have brought her to.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Hail, gentle sir.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Sir, speed you: what's your will?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Do you hear aught, sir, of a battle toward?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Most sure and vulgar: every one hears that,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Which can distinguish sound.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: But, by your favour,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: How near's the other army?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Near and on speedy foot; the main descry

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Stands on the hourly thought.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: I thank you, sir: that's all.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Though that the queen on special cause is here,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Her army is moved on.

text_entry: You lords and noble friends, know our intent.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: What comfort to this great decay may come

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Shall be applied: for us we will resign,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: During the life of this old majesty,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: To him our absolute power:

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: To EDGAR and KENT

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: you, to your rights:

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: With boot, and such addition as your honours

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Have more than merited. All friends shall taste

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: The wages of their virtue, and all foes

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: The cup of their deservings. O, see, see!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And my poor fool is hang'd! No, no, no life!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Why should a dog, a horse, a rat, have life,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And thou no breath at all? Thou'lt come no more,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Never, never, never, never, never!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Pray you, undo this button: thank you, sir.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Do you see this? Look on her, look, her lips,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Look there, look there!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Dies

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: He faints! My lord, my lord!

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Break, heart; I prithee, break!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Look up, my lord.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Vex not his ghost: O, let him pass! he hates him much

speaker: KENT
text_entry: That would upon the rack of this tough world

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Stretch him out longer.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: He is gone, indeed.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: The wonder is, he hath endured so long:

speaker: KENT
text_entry: He but usurp'd his life.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Bear them from hence. Our present business

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Is general woe.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: To KENT and EDGAR

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Friends of my soul, you twain

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Rule in this realm, and the gored state sustain.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: I have a journey, sir, shortly to go;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: My master calls me, I must not say no.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: The weight of this sad time we must obey;

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Speak what we feel, not what we ought to say.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: The oldest hath borne most: we that are young

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Shall never see so much, nor live so long.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Exeunt, with a dead march
